info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 4:54PM EDT until August 10 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR STANLY COUNTY... At 453 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Rockwell to near Midland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. At 443 PM, law enforcement reported trees down near Locust. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Badin Lake, Plyler, Fairview In Union County, Locust, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Richfield and New London. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
